newsitem.title: INDIA: India Infosys 96/97 first half net up at 141.1 mln.
newsitem.headline: India Infosys 96/97 first half net up at 141.1 mln.

text.p: India's leading software firm Infosys Technologies said on Wednesday its 1996/97 (April-March) first half net profit rose to 141.1 million rupees from 80.1 million rupees in the year-ago period.
The company said the turnover for the first six months increased to 617.6 million rupees, posting a 58 percent growth.
The company based in the southern city of Bangalore said it recommended an interim dividend of 15 percent.

"This half-yearly performance is in line with the company's commitment to enhancing employee productivity and maintaining effective cost control," N. R. Narayana Murthy, Infosys' chairman and managing director, said in a statement.
"We expect it to be another good year for the company."
The firm said its export revenue was up 57 percent to 515.6 million while its operating profit rose 61 percent to 210.3 million from 130.3 million rupees.
It said its depreciation climbed 29 percent to 42.3 million and its provision for tax rose to 24.0 million, up 40 percent from last year's figure of 17.2 million rupees.
The company said its new software centre at Pune become operational from May 1996. It has plans to set up new development centres at Madras and Bhubaneshwar.
Infosys' shares rose 18.0 rupees to a provisional 649.0 rupees close with 40,800 shares traded at the Bombay Stock Exchange.
